sound

Class Pitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • sound.Pitch

  • public class Pitch
extends java.lang.Object
    Pitch represents the frequency of a musical note. Standard music notation represents pitches by letters: A, B, C, ..., G. Pitches can be sharp or flat, or whole octaves up or down from these primitive generators. For example: new Pitch('C') makes middle C. new Pitch('C').transpose(1) makes C-sharp. new Pitch('F').transpose(-2) makes E-flat. new Pitch('C').transpose(OCTAVE) makes high C. new Pitch('C').transpose(-OCTAVE) makes low C.

      Number of pitches in an octave.

      • Pitch

        public Pitch(char c)
        Make a Pitch. Return Pitch named c in the middle octave of the piano keyboard. * For example, new Pitch('C') constructs middle C.
        Parameters:
        c - a note in {'A',...,'G'}

    • Method Detail

      • accidentalTranspose

        public Pitch accidentalTranspose(int semitonesUp)
        Transposes the accidental of the Pitch and turns hasAccidental to true.
        Returns:
        pitch made by adding semitonesUp sharps to this pitch, if the argument is positive, or -semitonesUp flats, if the argument is negative. For example, E transposed by -1 semitone is E flat; E transposed by 1 semitone is E sharp.

      • octaveTranspose

        public Pitch octaveTranspose(int octavesUp)
        Returns:
        pitch made by transposing this pitch by octavesUp octaves up. For example, transposing E up by 1 octave produces E' ; transposing E down by 1 octave produces E, .

      • transpose

        public Pitch transpose(int semitonesUp)
        Returns:
        pitch made by transposing this pitch up by semitonesUp semitones, as if on a minor scale starting at this pitch. For example, transposing E up by 3 semitones will produce G; transposing F up by 5 semitones will produce B flat.

      • difference

        public int difference(Pitch that)
        Returns:
        number of semitones between this and that; i.e., n such that that.transpose(n).toMidiNote() == this.toMidiNote().

      • toMidiNote

        public int toMidiNote()
        Returns:
        the midi note of this pitch

      • lessThan

        public boolean lessThan(Pitch that)
        Returns:
        true iff this pitch is lower than that pitch
